intro: Gomphia claussenii, commonly known as the Cape mountain heath, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and related plants. The plant is characterized by its dense, shrub-like growth and small, leathery leaves. It produces clusters of bright red or pink flowers during the summer months. Gomphia claussenii is adapted to grow in nutrient-poor, acidic soils and is often found in rocky or coastal areas.
